"AERO é o primeiro lançamento da Hidra Games, e já nasce um verdadeiro clássico: um jogo de estratégia abstrata para dois jogadores, com informação completa, boa dinâmica e nenhum elemento de sorte.
Os componentes são de alta qualidade e resistência, com argolas e fichas de PVC.
O jogo possui imensa rejogabilidade, pois a posição inicial das argolas transparentes iniciais pode mudar a cada rodada, proporcionando partidas extremamente diferentes."



THE GAMEIn a 6x6 board, 2 players alternate turns putting rings and chips (inside the rings) in the spaces. The winner is the first player to use all of his chips or all of his rings.

Anytime a player gets to form a row (orthogonally or diagonally) with 4 rings or 4 chips, he is allowed to put a new chip on the board.

A player can put a chip over an opponent's chip, but be aware: the third chip played in a single stack is the last one, and it allows the player to change the color of the ring - blue player can take a red ring from the board and put a blue ring in the same space if he got to play a blue chip as a third one in that stack.

There are also 4 white neutral rings in the start of the game, used to give even more replayability.

102782.name: Clash of Empires
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures Episode 77 - Clash of the Ancients
102782.description:
Copied from the official webpage:

Clash of Empires is the new tabletop wargaming rules from Great Escape Games. Clash of Empires is a full colour, hardcover book Here are some key features:

THE GAME

We mainly play with 28mm figures but the rules are adaptable to 15mm and 20mm armies as well.

For a typical sized game of Clash of Empires, number of models will vary by army – our own Carthaginian army has 155 men and our Early Imperial Romans 125 men.

There will be plenty of dice to roll.

The turn sequence is: Orders Phase, Movement Phase, Shooting Phase, Hand-to-hand Phase and Combat Outcomes Phase.

SOLDIERS OF ANTIQUITY

Troops’ profiles are: Movement Rate; Shoot; Attacks; Hand-to-Hand; Defence; Kill; Hits; Discipline; MoralE.

Troop morale is vital but troop discipline is a separate characteristic and can be just as important.

Units have profiles to determine how good they are but may also have Unit Special Rules such as Cantabrian Circle (Skythians), Expert Swordsmen (e.g. Legionaries) and Shieldwall (e.g. Saxon infantry) to name a few.

Different weapons are well represented according to their historical uses - the pilum is used as a thrown weapon before combat disrupting the enemy formation, and the pike enables more attacks but suffers if the unit is pushed back in combat.

ARMY LISTS

Army lists are very expansive and you choose your unit size by individual models within set minimums and maximums (e.g. a Roman auxiliary infantry unit has 10-30 models in it).

Units within the army list are 'flavoured' for that period so that a Roman Legionary is different to a Viking Hirdman, rather than both being superior Heavy Infantry.

Generals and other characters command, they are not super killing machines. This can be a good excuse to do diorama bases for your leaders if you are so inclined.

Clash of Empires even has a use for those casualty figures you never painted!

THE RULEBOOK

In the rulebook will be lists for the Early Imperial Romans and its enemies in the west – Ancient Germans, Ancient British, Caledonians and Dacians.

The first army list book will cover Early Achaemenid Persia to the death of Alexander.

Many army lists will be free to download from the web. They will be official but will be living lists reviewed by us and the wargaming community. Some of these will go to print but many will stay on the website as free downloads.

The rulebook also contains rules for four different scenarios including elements such as terrain placement, terrain types, army initiative and flanking manoeuvres.

102783.name: Sure Shot Basketball
102783.description:
The object of Sure Shot Basketball game is to be the player to score 15 Baskets. Players take turns at being the SHOOTER and the BLOCKER for a period of 5 shots. When a SHOOTER attempts 5 shots his turn is over. Players then change places so that the player who was the SHOOTER becomes the BLOCKER. They continue changing places after each 5 shots.

Contents:

1 Base
1 Arch
1 Backboard
1 Basket
1 Shooter
1 Shooter's shooter
1 Blocker
2 Basketballs

102785.name: Whoops
102785.description:
From the Manufacturer:
There are 12 Whoops stepping stones on the floor. Players
challenge their balancing skills in this whole body game that requires agility and coordination. To play Whoops, players take turns placing numbered stones in any pattern they choose. Players must then pick up each stone in numerical order - but they have to balance on the other stones, without touching the ground! One little slip and the turn are over.

102786.name: Hip Hopscotch
102786.description: Hip Hopscotch combines the old and new in a contemporary version of hopscotch. Offered several placement options, players set up the game pads in wildly creative patterns and then take turns jumping and moving from START to STOP. Players must not land on the ground or miss a number. They must be quick on their feet, too, as special direction pads require them to do certain kinds of jumps.

102787.name: Polymath
102787.description: Traffic magnetic game. Players use their seven drawn letter-tiles to form words on the gameboard. Each word laid out earns points based on the commonality of the letters used, with certain board spaces giving bonuses. But a word can only be played if it uses at least one already-played tile or adds to an already-played word. This leads to slightly tactical play, as potential words are rejected because they would give an opponent too much access to the better bonus spaces.

102788.name: Upset
102788.description: Toss the Bean Bags and be the first player to get at least one bean bag in each of their 3 cups. Hit the upset button to dump your opponent bean bags.

102791.name: The Hooker
102791.description:
When the night settles on the city of New Sodomy nightly creatures begin their work. The customers are waiting and need sadisfaction...

In Hooker players try to work their way up on the human market - selling themselves. Players have 6 skills (oral, anal, vaginal, fetish, social, lesbian)and stamina which is used up as the night passes.

There is two ways to win: when a hooker has collected $ 50 she's able to buy herself out of the system and get a normal life; if a hooker should get 3 points in every skill she'll be offered a work in high-class establisment and she can get off the streets.

102792.name: Zero
102792.description:
If you have always wondered what it feels like to be a complete Zero, then this game is for you! Zero is the exciting family game that asks players to search their minds for the "least popular" aspects of pop culture. More than 450 people were surveyed in the US, UK, Australia and Mexico and University Games tabulated their answers to hundreds of questions. Now, you and your friends can match wits with them to see who comes up with the "least" likely answer. Each Card lists all of the correct answers to each question and points are awarded based on the popularity of the answer. The winner is the player who scores closest to zero when the game ends!

Contents Include: 270 Question Cards, Game Board, 6 Moving Pieces, 18 Tokens and Instructions

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2013 Meeples' Choice Nominee
2014 Guldbrikken Best Adult Game Nominee
2014 Guldbrikken Best Adult Game Winner
2014 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
2014 Spiel der Spiele Hit mit Freunden Recommended
102794.description:
Following along the same lines as its predecessor (Agricola), Caverna: The Cave Farmers is a worker-placement game at heart, with a focus on farming. In the game, you are the bearded leader of a small dwarf family that lives in a little cave in the mountains. You begin the game with a farmer and his spouse, and each member of the farming family represents an action that the player can take each turn. Together, you cultivate the forest in front of your cave and dig deeper into the mountain. You furnish the caves as dwellings for your offspring as well as working spaces for small enterprises.

It's up to you how much ore you want to mine. You will need it to forge weapons that allow you to go on expeditions to gain bonus items and actions. While digging through the mountain, you may come across water sources and find ore and ruby mines that help you increase your wealth. Right in front of your cave, you can increase your wealth even further with agriculture: You can cut down the forest to sow fields and fence in pastures to hold your animals. You can also expand your family while running your ever-growing farm. In the end, the player with the most efficiently developed home board wins.

You can also play the solo variant of this game to familiarize yourself with the 48 different furnishing tiles for your cave.

Caverna: The Cave Farmers, which has a playing time of roughly 30 minutes per player, is a complete redesign of Agricola that substitutes the card decks from the former game with a set of buildings while adding the ability to purchase weapons and send your farmers on quests to gain further resources. Designer Uwe Rosenberg says that the game includes parts of Agricola, but also has new ideas, especially the cave part of your game board, where you can build mines and search for rubies. The game also includes two new animals: dogs and donkeys.
102794.name: Caverna: The Cave Farmers

102795.name: Offensive Patrol
102795.description: Offensive Patrol is a supplement for the Hostile Aircraft WW1 miniatures dogfighting rules. This book contains 101 historically accurare scenarios of offensive patrols during WW1. It extends the setting to fighting thru the Russian Revolution and includes both big and minor nations,

102796.name: Tephra (Playtest Edition)
102796.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Don your top hat and grab your aether-blasting shotgun - you are about to enter the steam-powered world of Tephra. Enjoy the elegance, poise, and aesthetic of a Victorian world while you're ripping 50 calibers through airship pirates, sword-fighting with gentleman swashbucklers, and taking down hulking automatons with nothing but your hunting knife clenched between your gritted teeth.

Tephra is an evolutionary roleplaying experience, D12 built by gamers who enjoy an easy-to-learn system with unlimited options. You'll feel at home in our easy to use system, with just one die (a twelve-sider), over 400 different character abilities, and a seemingly unlimited amount of character combinations. We've done away with the class - you build your character the way you see them, the way you want them to work. Everything's available from level 1, and it only gets better.

Then delve into our rich and easy crafting system. Customize your razor-edged, chainsawing claymore or your electrified, steam-powered longrifle to your heart's content. And it doesn't stop at weapons - you can build an entire automaton, customizing its body, the way it thinks, the weapon's it uses, and how it functions, and, when you're done with that one, build another! And steampunk wouldn't be complete with airships, dirigibles, and locomotives. And, of course, you can build them all! Customize your train so that it has a deployable helium-filled envelope, is entirely amphibious, has magnetech cannons lining its side, and has a roaring engine that nobody can out pace. And that's just the beginning.

From our easy character creation system to our intuitive and high-movement combat rules to our enormous array of character abilities, Tephra will leave you building, creating, and dreaming until you can't take it anymore. This is steampunk - the options are unlimited.

102797.description:
Game description from the publisher:

A horde of Orcs has gathered at The Iron Rock, eager for fightin', slayin' and lootin'. No land is safe when the Greenskins go to war...

The Iron Rock is the third Battle Pack in "The Capital Cycle" for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game! With half of its cards devoted to the warmongering greenskins, The Iron Rock is an invaluable Battle Pack for players of the stunty-smashin' Orc horde.

Not an Orc player? Fans of other races will also find a variety of useful tactics, units, and support options. While a Blessing of Asuryan shines down upon the High Elves' greatest mages, the vile Beastman Shaman feeds on the corruption of his allies. Meanwhile, the Bretonnian Black Knight engages in some offensive questing, and the Burial Mound gives the forces of the undead a new source of power! The Greenskin horde is gathering under a banner of war, and unless they are stopped, their Waaagh! will leave the Old World in ruins. Prepare for the onslaught!
102797.name: Warhammer: Invasion – The Iron Rock

102798.name: Breach
102798.description:
Back of Box

We want you... for the Federated Worlds Special Forces.

"I was moving a squad of four of my best through the kehst-beridden jungles of Kiskismok, when suddenly Darrow's detector picks up what looks like a couple of life forms 50 meters out."

"'Nothin' but a couple of those brachiators,' he says to me. Just then Darrow takes it through the chest."

"We all drop into the mud, flipping through our helmet displays trying to find out where the shot came from, when I hear this rumbling. More like I feel this rumbling. An' then there it is. A battle robot."

"'Roki,' I said, 'Direct your fire into the lifters so it can't move. These things are pretty lousy about protecting their undersides.' So like he was a vet of 20 drops, he rises to one knee and hits the thing right in the lifters. And then he does it twice more."

"'That's one less battle robot,' he says. I toss an energy grenade at the hulk just to make sure. Then we turned to start the long job of carrying the boys north, where we knew the landing boat would be."


The Serayachi Campaign -- Sgt. Robert Sherwood, FWSF Ret.


Breach is a single-player tactical-level combat game for one person. It features:


Smooth animated movement and combat.
The ability to lead squads of up to 20 marines.
A campaign of several scenarios included with the game.
Up to 40 opponents per scenario--ranging from vicious beasts to marines as intelligent and well-equipped as your own. Six different classes of opponents in all: marine, alien, beast, overlord, autogun, and battle robot.
Equip your marines with 20 different types of objects--including rocket launchers, demolition charges, first aid kits, and cracking units to break into enemy computer systems.
Four different classes of marine: marauder, infiltrator, scout, and psionic talent.
Your squad leader is independent of any scenario--play Breach just like a role-playing game or as a single-session wargame.
Build-up your squad leader for special advanced training--all of his combat experience is saved!
Breach includes a Scenario Builder--create your own scenarios or modify existing ones!

102800.name: Warlords III: Reign of Heroes
videogamehonor: 1998 D.I.C.E. Strategy Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
102800.description:
User Description:

The third game of the Warlords series, it was SSG's first game released through a different publisher, and marked the beginning of the decline of the classic '80s computer game company. It was followed a year later by Warlords III: Darklords Rising which was a rework of this release, with a new UI color scheme, new scenarios, and a new soundtrack.

While Darklords Rising featured improvements to the engine, Rise of Heroes was still a solid fantasy conquest game. While the game largely stayed true to the features of the previous games, new ideas were added in combat and the like. For the first time a single-player campaign was included, using factions from the first game, but with an entirely new world.

102801.name: The Dukes of Hazzard: Racing for Home
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
102801.description:
In this game you play as Bo and Luke Duke who is racing to pay off the Duke farm. Along the way you have missions that fit the Dukes style, from out running Roscoe and Enos to saving their cousin Daisy from Black Jack Perril who wants revenge on their uncle Jesse Duke. You never run out of things to do in Hazzard county. This game also features the voices of Waylon Jennings, James Best, Ben Jones, Sonny Shroyer, and Tom Wopat. It was followed by a sequel titled Dukes Of Hazzard II: Daisy Dukes It Out.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dukes of hazzard raceing for home", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102802.name: Tidewater Traveller Times (Volume 1, Issue 2 - Jul 1987)
102802.description:
Origins Report

From the Credits:

The Tidewater Traveller TIMES is the official newsletter of the Tidewater Traveller Club.

The section "GEO's VARIANTS", normally only included in club member's copies, is included in this issue for promotional purposes.

Editor: Mark "Mad Geo" Gelinas

102804.name: SVC Chaos: SNK vs. Capcom
102804.description:
From the Game Box

The clash between the greatest fighting giants is on! ...as SNK brings players the ultimate battle for supremacy in this dream match of all fighting games.

Includes 36 characters from world famous SNK and Capcom games such as Fatal Fury, Samurai Shodown, The King of Fighters and Street Fighter.

102805.name: Living Arcanis Rules Compilation
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102805.description:
From Introduction:

LIVING ARCANIS is an RPGA d20 System member-run campaign set in Arcanis, the World of Shattered Empires. The campaign world is developed and supported by Paradigm Concepts, Inc. through a variety of products, although participants are not required to purchase any of PCI’s products to take part in the LIVING ARCANIS campaign. For an introduction to RPGA Living Campaigns in general, see the official RPGA website. For an introduction to LIVING ARCANIS in particular, see the official campaign website, which is known as Onara Online. There is also a lively discussion forum dedicated entirely to the LIVING ARCANIS campaign, which is frequently visited by the campaign staff (who are collectively known as the “LIVING ARCANIS Development Team”) and by members of Paradigm Concepts (who are collectively known as “Team PCI.”)

This document includes rules to cover various elements of the Dungeons & Dragons® game that have not previously been addressed in the LIVING ARCANIS campaign. The rules and changes contained herein are considered effective for the entire campaign as of the date listed on the title page.

Please be aware that these guidelines, like the LIVING ARCANIS campaign as a whole, will change over time as both the ongoing story and the campaign setting evolve. Our commitment to you, the player, is that our primary goal with any changes will be to add options to characters (as more D&D® and Arcanis material is published), not to take away options. With that said, there may be times, however infrequent, when we may have to restrict choices that were previously available to preserve game balance or story cohesiveness. Know that we will only do so after careful consideration.

102806.name: Crack in the Dome of Night
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102806.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

This module begins the first story arc of the Nishanpur campaign: Under the Sword. Characters need not have played any other Nishanpur modules, and it is expected this is the characters' first introduction to the City of Secrets. It is helpful if at least one character at the table has played in Temptations of the Flesh, and possibly also Bargains of Flesh and Spirit. It is recommended that other characters have played some Arcanis modules before and that they be somewhat familiar with the world of Onara, though this is not strictly necessary.

It is necessary to start the characters outside the city proper, as this city has many strange (to outsiders) laws. Please refer to the Nishanpur information packet available for reference if you need to review some further city background before beginning. Please note that in the area of Nishanpur itself, nearly everyone speaks in a whisper. This is part of the flavor of this city, and the GM is encouraged to roleplay this as much as is practical. Allow the players time to roleplay as well, and enjoy the flavor of this dark part of the world.

102807.name: On the Red March
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102807.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

This module continues the first story arc of the Nishanpur campaign: Under the Sword. It is highly recommended that PCs have played [HP1], before continuing on to this module. It is recommended that players have played some Arcanis modules before and that they be somewhat familiar with the world of Onara, though this is not strictly necessary.

102808.name: Missile Command (PS1/Windows)
102808.description:
From the Back of the PS1 Edition Case

Missle Command: Get ready to take command.

Execute a devasting counterattack against a massive alien invasion in the this all-new edition of Missle Command. There are two heart-pounding ways to play. In the Classic game, you defend cities from a shower of aliean missles. And just like the original game, the longer you play, the more missles you must destro. In the ultimate game, you battle aliens by city around the world in an ever-widening theater of war. Turn back the alien invasion and save the Earth!

Features
-Couter-strike capabilities now allow you to turn back invasion and win the game.
-Fantastic new worlds, weapons, power-ups, and enemies.

102809.name: WarJetz
102809.description:
From the Game Box

It's Wednesday night and time to fight in the World Destruction League's latest contribution to televised mega-destruction and mayhem: WarJetz! The brawl take to the unfriendly skies, separating the rookies from the pros in an aerial battle for the ultimate title of Air Lord.

102810.name: Silly Season
102810.description:
You are the newly appointed manager of one of the largest football clubs in the country.The expectations a sky high and the goal is clear: buy new players and build a team for the top.

In the game you move around the board answering questions about players, arenas, championship etc. This gives you money to build your team. Can you afford to use an agent or do you have to make a panic transfer? Using an agent will probably give you players with higher confidence points.

The winner is the player who has gathered the most confidence points.

102811.name: Tkodi
102811.description:
Games with the five only real dice - a collection of three games.

In "555", players try to form a chain where every bigger dice shows a bigger number.

In "Alles of niks", players try to form the longest chain of rolling ever higher numbers on dice of their choice.

In "Thodi", two players try to win dice by rolling a higher number than the opponent.

102812.name: Indoor Soccer
102812.description:
In this game 2 teams play an indoor soccer match.
The 2 players of this game both are coaches of one team.
Both coaches have 5 player figures (incl. the goalie).
A die determines your number of spaces to move one of your figures. If you reach the ball you shoot the ball by the unused number of pips on the die.
The die makes luck a part of this game. But your choices, like which player you move to which field and where to pass the ball are very important. For the following turns you calculate chances for your opponent and yourself and you try to have your players in good positions for later situations.

Predecessor of Streetsoccer.

102813.name: Biopolis
102813.description:
Biopolis is a city state where food production is important. In this game, every player is a food producer, importer, and seller. Next to that, every player can influence consumer behavior, and politics.

Every player has an ideal picture of the future norms. Winner of the game is the player, who is able to best realize his future vision!

An educational game about food production, distribution and consumption.

102814.name: Thundercade
102814.description:
User summary

In Thundercade you pit yourself against evil AATOM, a terrorist organization that wants to bring nuclear winter upon the world. Your arsenal includes a high-performance motorcycle with sidebar cannons which can be upgraded as you progress. While fighting through city streets, forests and strongholds, you can also call in a precision B-7 bomber as air support to help wipe out the opposition. Can you make it to the final fortress and save the world?

102815.name: Castlevania II: Belmont's Revenge
102815.description:
The second Castlevania game on the Game Boy is set 15 years after the events in Castlevania: The Adventure. Dracula kidnaps Christopher Belmont's son Soleiyu at his coming of age feast, and turns him into a demon. With Soleiyu's mystical powers, Dracula retakes human form and rebuilds his castle, forcing Christopher to confront Dracula once again to save his son and Transylvania.

Unlike the previous Game Boy title, sub-weapons in the form of holy water and axes are available in the game. There are four initial levels, each taking place in a separate castle with unique theme such as air, plant, earth, and crystal, and can be completed in any order. There are also very large trap rooms in the levels. The game also utilizes a password system.

Source: Wikipedia, "Castlevania II: Belmont's Revenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102816.name: Vampire Killer
102816.description:
User Summary

Released shortly after Castlevania, Vampire Killer combines platforming with a more open ended adventure scheme in which Simon Belmont navigates Dracula's castle to collect keys in order to advance to the final confrontation with the count. Konami opted for a more traditional platforming adventure, and Vampire Killer never made it to America. However, its style of play was a precursor to Castlevania II: Simon's Quest and Castlevania: Symphony of the Night

102817.description:
Stock Market, the first expansion to Recycle - Critical Times, adds new ways of making money and turning them into victory points.

As the society awareness about the relevance of recycling grows, industries have to develop the ability to absorb the huge amount of material collected to be recycled. It is now time to make investments in those industries!

COMPONENTS
1 Stock-Market board
30 stocks cards with six of each kind of material
Rulebook

This expansion also adds some rules adaptations from the original game.
102817.name: Recicle: Tempos de Crise – Stock Market expansion

102818.name: Total Recall
102818.description:
User summary

You play Douglas Quaid and travel to Mars in search of your stolen memories. Armed only with your strong punch and possible weapons you pick up from guards, you must fight your way through police, soldiers and a collection of monstrosities who try to stop you. You can replenish your energy by collecting pills or hearts throughout the game's nine levels. Can you find out who is hunting you and why?

Total Recall is based on the movie of the same name. It also includes cutscenes between levels that describe the movie’s plot

102820.name: Armed Police Batrider
102820.description:
Armed Police Batrider (アームドポリス バトライダー) is a vertically scrolling manic shooter arcade game developed and published by Raizing/Eighting in 1998. The player controls teams of flying jet bikes (Batriders) each with their own pilot; players can choose up to three of nine standard characters plus another nine unlockable characters from the previous Raizing games Mahou Daisakusen and Battle Garegga. Batrider contains up to seven stages along with a large number of secrets, which are either unlockable with codes or DIP switch settings, or hidden within the game itself.

Source: Wikipedia, "Armed Police Batrider," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102825.name: Pokémon: Les Champions de Hoenn
102825.description:
From the back of the box (translated from the original French):

"Catch all your favorite Pokémon and become the best Pokémon Trainer! The box of Pokémon: Les Champions de Hoenn contains four different card games to discover with your parents or your friends. You will be able to catch the most famous Pokémon of the Hoenn region, (but also Pokémon from other regions) and finally initiate your parents to the secrets of Pokémon!

"Four games for the best trainers to play with your family or friends!

Les Champions de Hoenn box contains a deck of 60 cards and a reference poster. There 7 cards of each of 7 colors (Pokémon types), plus 18 gray Pokémon cards.

The four games you can play with these cards are:

Le jeu des familles (the family game). A variation of Go Fish for 3 to 5 players where your goal is to gather all the Pokémon of one color, asking for Pokémon by name.

Le memory-la chasse aux Pokémon (Memory-the hunt of Pokémon). A variation on the memory game for 2 to 4 players, where you try to uncover the 2 or 3 cards that represent a Pokémon and its evolutions.

La bataille-l'arene Pokémon (The battle-the Pokémon arena). A variation of War for 2 players.

Le jeu du Pokédex (The Pokédex game). An original game for 2 to 6 players where you have to decide what cards to play in order to draw more cards, and which cards to keep for scoring at the end of the game.

102826.name: Tidewater Traveller Times (Volume 1, Issue 3 - Aug 1987)
102826.description:
Special GEOCON Issue

From the Credits:

The Tidewater Traveller TIMES is the official newsletter of the Tidewater Traveller Club.

Editor: Mark "Mad Geo" Gelinas

102827.name: Tidewater Traveller Times (Volume 1, Issue 4 - Sep 1987)
102827.description:
GEOCON Report

From the Credits:

The Tidewater Traveller TIMES is the official newsletter of the Tidewater Traveller Club.

Editor: Mark "Mad Geo" Gelinas

102828.name: Bébé's Kids
102828.description:
Bébé's Kids is an action-oriented Super NES video game that is loosely based on the movie of the same name. The video game enjoyed a North America-exclusive release. Nintendo Power gave this game a 2.475 out of 5 rating (49.5%) in its January 1994 issue.

Using the style of a Streets of Rage/Golden Axe style of beat 'em up, the player must control either LaShawn (the female protagonist) or Kahlil (the male protagonist) as they devastate a Disneylandesque theme park being the troublemakers they are. Players must watch out for security guards, disgruntled mascots, and pirates (that are employees of the theme park). Other stages include a haunted house,[8] a pirate ship, and the pits. Both characters have their own special attacks. Enemies take an excessively long time to eliminate; thus dragging the difficulty level beyond that of the film's target audience. An oppressive time limit make sure that only professional gamers have a fair chance of completing each level.

Coke cans look like items that can be picked up. In reality, there are a part of the background even though they appear on the same sprite layer as the main character and the enemies.[5] There are three sprite layers in the game: the background, the foreground, and the main action layer. The game was rushed for release in order to complement the VHS release of the movie that it was named after. While a MIDI version of a hip hop tune is good for the first fifteen seconds of the game, the soundtrack eventually becomes repetitive and boring.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bébé's Kids", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102829.name: Dream TV
102829.description:
Dream TV is a Super Nintendo action video game where the player has to guide two youngsters through a nightmarish land of evil television shows (using a similar plot to the campy movie Stay Tuned). The player has to escape by defeating stereotypical television villains and finding pieces of a puzzle. The game features complex labyrinths.

National video gamers Charlie and Jimmy are given a strange game in the mail. After loading a strange-looking game cartridge, the boys find themselves transported into the game. They are sucked in by an evil being known as the Critic. Now Jimmy and Charlie must fight for their lives through four Dream Worlds (Medieval, Egyptian, Prehistoric, and Future) if they hope to return home safely. Collecting nine hidden puzzle pieces from each level will take the guys to the final showdown with the Critic and hopefully back to reality.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dream TV", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102830.name: ESP Ra.De.
102830.description:
ESP Ra. De. is a vertically scrolling manic shooter arcade game developed by Cave and published by Atlus in 1998. Unlike most other shmups, ESP Ra. De. has a somewhat involved story and setting. The Game received 2 prequels in the form of Espgaluda and Espgaluda II.

By 2018, Tokyo has reached its maximum extension, therefore falling prey of common problems such as overpopulation and criminality. For this reason, an artificial island, aptly named Tokyo-2, is created just offshore, thanks to the support of the shady "Yaksa" corporation, led by elusive billionaire Garra Ono, whose ties with the modern incarnation of Yakuza have not been proved. Another source of unstability is given by the rising number of humans exhibiting extrasensory perception, the so called ESPers, who are constantly hunted down by the Japanese Police force.
Unknown to everyone, Garra herself is an extremely powerful ESPer, bent on using her influence over the government and military to replace every living being in the city with clones (disturbingly enough, these ESPers take the form of a 10 years old girl, named "Alice" and implied to originate from Garra's own DNA). Just as her plans begin to unfold, three children are forced to take action, each one for his or her own personal motives.
The story takes place in December, during a 24-hour arc: each character has a specific stage which initiates his/her storyline, then culminating with the final encounter.

Source: Wikipedia, "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ESP_Ra.De. ESP Ra.De.]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102831.name: Progear
102831.description:
Progear is an arcade video game developed by CAVE and published by Capcom on the CPS-2 arcade system board in 2001. This was Cave's only horizontal scrolling shooter until DeathSmiles in 2007. The game features a steampunk-like style and art design. This game is the second of two CAVE shoot 'em ups to be released in America with the third CAVE NTSC-U/C release being Princess Debut, and in limited print; and as a result, the US version is somewhat rare.

Source: Wikipedia, "Progear", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102832.name: The Golems of Ymhet
102832.description:
The Golems of Ymhet is a 3-player strategy game (with a 2-player variant) that pits two players against one, but the two teammates don't know which of the other players is their teammate. A mix of psychology and strategy helps the story of the defense of the city unfold, all to be decided in epic combat.

Each of the three players acts as an enchanter, preparing his golem for battle. Two of the players are loyal to Ymhet and want to defend it against the invaders, but the other will fight for Bakonia. In the first part of the game, the players prepare their own golems and sabotage the ones belong to those they believe to be their enemies. Once the invasion force arrives, the traitor is revealed and the actual battle for Ymhet begins. If the loyal players destroy the enemy golem and all invading forces, the town remains in their own hands. If any of the invaders or the invading golem breaks through the city walls, they seize control in the name of the empire.

102833.name: The VCR Golf game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 75: VCR Golf
102833.description: The object of VCR Golf game is to use the least amount of strokes, over 9 or 18 holes of golf. Exciting gameplay, combined with a VHS tape that includes over 250 shots featuring the premier PGA TOUR golfers, results in the most realistic golf game ever. And using your own ball and favorite putter, you can sink green shots with free putting cup included. Fore!

102834.name: Disney's TaleSpin
102834.description:
User Summary

This platform game is based on the cartoon show of the same name. You, alone or with a friend, take the role of either Baloo or Kit, and pit yourselves against crafty Shere Khan’s company in the zaniest adventure of all: To earn a lucrative lifetime air transport contract from the city by winning a breathtaking contest. Pilot the Sea Duck or ride the currents on your airfoil and try to open the exit in each level by collecting at least ten cargo boxes. You must thwart the plans of the opposition who will use all kinds of tricks to stop you!

102835.description:
In Lost Temple, the players are explorers looking for a mysterious lost temple. To find it, they must cross the jungle and get help from the indigenous people. The first player to reach the temple on the last space of the track wins the game.

The game uses a character selection rule similar to Faidutti's Citadels, and the game includes nine different characters: Shaman, Thief, Seer, Priest, Elder, Craftsman, Scout, Canoe and Child.

In the dense jungle of southeast Asia you must take your chances and start your journey. As an explorer, you will cross the jungle and ask help from the local people. But can you outwit your opponents and claim the discovery of the Lost Temple?
102835.name: Lost Temple

102836.name: Nightprowler (2nd edition)
102836.description:
From the back of the book:

"Dans la Principauté des Sept Cités, les feux de la guerre civile se sont éteints, mais sous les cendres la braise couve..."

C'est un âge difficile: le peuple est pauvre et meurt de faim, la noblesse et la bourgeoisie se disputent les faveurs d'une église toujours plus puissante, et dans l'ombre, les grandes Familles du crime se livrent une guerre secrète et sans merci. La censure est partout, la science est proscrite, la république une hérésie oubliée, il n'y a plus d'avenir pour la jeunesse. C'est le règne de la débrouille, et nombreux sont ceux qui se tournent vers le crime organisé...

C'est cette voie que vous avez choisie. Désormais, vous êtes un hors-la-loi, un rôdeur, un voleur, ou l'un de ces mendiants qui hantent les recoins sordides de la Principauté. Prêt à tout, peut-être serez-vous la flamme qui ravivera les espoirs déçus des générations trahies?

in English

"In the Principality of the Seven Cities, the fires of civil war died out, but the embers are still aglow under the ashes ..."

It's a difficult age: the people are poor and starving, the nobility and the bourgeoisie compete for a church ever more powerful, and in the shadows, the great crime families are engaged in a secret war without mercy. Censorship is everywhere, science is outlawed, the Republic a forgotten heresy, there is no future for youth. It is the reign of resourcefulness, and many people are turning to organized crime ...

This is the path you have chosen. Now you're an outlaw, a ranger, a thief, or one of those beggars who haunt the squalid corners of the Principality. Ready for anything, maybe you'll be the flame that will rekindle the dashed hopes of betrayed generations ?

102837.name: GemCraft (mobile)
102837.description:
User Summary

The mobile version of GemCraft is a fantasy-themed Tower Defense game like the rest of the series. It is most similar to GemCraft Chapter Zero: Gem of Eternity in gameplay, but has new graphics, and several gameplay changes.

You defend your base by building towers and traps and filling them with gems. Gems can be combined to make stronger ones or dropped on monsters to do area of effect damage.

The game has been reworked in terms of skills and when different gems and abilities are available. This makes the first several levels an effective terminal as you are only able to do a few things.

Old levels are available to replay for more experience, this time in seven different modes, with the top score from each counting towards your experience total. In other words, there is a huge amount of game-play here.

Achievements are available on Game Center.

102838.description:
Star and Pyramid is a scenario and campaign book for the popular Check Your 6: Jet Age Air-Combat and Campaign Rules. The book provides comprehensive coverage of the air wars between Israel and Egypt between 1966 and 1973 under one cover with five campaigns and 27 scenarios.

* The first campaign covers the Israeli surprise attack on Egypt and the first two days of air battles in the 1967 Six-Day War while the second covers Egyptian attempts to strike back over the final four days of the war.
* The third campaign covers desperate Egyptian attempts to regain the initiative in the War of Attrition, between 1969-1972, by employing new aircraft, surface-to-air missiles, and direct involvement from the Soviet Union.
* The final two campaigns cover the aerial struggle between Israel and Egypt during the Yom Kippur War in 1973. The fourth campaign spotlights the desperate struggle of the Israeli Air Force against the massive air defense systems of Egypt. The fifth campaign covers the second half of the war, when Israel renewed deep-strike operations and faced a surviving and fighting Egyptian Air Force.

The book also features some of the world's top jet aces, including Michael "Diamond" Haber, Dan Sever, Giora Rom, Avraham Salmon, Israel Baharav, Yiftach Spector, Asher Snir, Eitan Peled, Amir Nachumi, Eitan Ben-Eliyahu and Shlomo Levi. The book also presents the little-known exploits of Egyptian pilots such as Mustafa Hafez, Nabil Shuwakri, Ahmad Atif, Qadri al-Hamid, and Nasr Mousa. The scenarios can be played individually, linked to form campaigns, or combined as one grand campaign.

HISTORICAL RESEARCH: This book includes several introduction sections containing campaign historical background, an annotated bibliography for further reading, a color scheme guide, and a campaign map.

AIRCRAFT STATISTICS and CAMPAIGN INFORMATION: This book contains aircraft statistics for more than 20 U.S., British, Israeli and Soviet-built aircraft in Check Your 6: Jet Age format for use in the scenarios. The book also contains detailed notes and rare pictures of the various aircraft featured in the campaign
102838.name: Check Your 6! Jet Age: Star and Pyramid

102839.name: Tecmo Cup Soccer Game
102839.description:
User Summary

In this exciting soccer game simulation with several RPG elements you play the role of Robin Field, an upcoming soccer player. Your goal is to lead your team from junior league all the way to the World Cup. As you progress upon your endeavor, you gradually gain mastery of advanced soccer skills such as dribbling, tackling, passing or marking the opposition players. Will you make it to the greatest soccer championship and win the World Cup finals?

102842.name: Unbridled Servants
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102842.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

Since Leonydas val’Virdan, the Sword of the Heavens conquered Nishanpur; many citizens are divided in their loyalty. This is especially true among the noble houses in Nishanpur. Although the Sarishans seem complacent to the rule of the Cleansing Flame, there is a Sarishan faction called the Brotherhood scheming to overthrow the Nierite rule.

In the past year, there have been some ill omens for Sarish, such as the mysterious death of many cats (So Shall Ye Reap). The Brotherhood decided to take advantage of those omens and started to spread rumors of Sarish's power weakening, and that infernals are coming through the Wall of the Gods.

The Brotherhood have been ambushing the Swords of Nier with summoned infernals near the Wall of the Gods. To further their plans, they are secretly creating defective Sarishan steel weapons for the Swords of Nier. They hope to escalate the affair into a crisis, and lure the Swords of Nier away from Nishanpur.

102843.name: Silence, Silver, and Secrets
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102843.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

This module is the beginning of the LIVING ARCANIS: NISHANPUR Year 2 story arc, which is entitled “Confessions and Consequences.” The PCs do not have to have played any of the previous Nishanpur modules, although it is helpful if they are at least somewhat familiar with the LIVING ARCANIS universe. Any standard LA character that falls within the legal range of levels for play is fine, but players should be encouraged to play native Canceri characters in this story arc if possible.

The civil war in Canceri has now entered its second year. The Sword of the Heavens led his armies across Milandir during the latter half of last year. This mighty army appeared to be on the brink of successfully conquering major portions of Milandir, when the Sword of the Heavens disappeared at the Citadel of Silence along with a substantial number of his troops. No word has since come from him, and in his absence, the remainder of the army was crushed at the Battle of Four Armies, which took place near the Milandisian city of Heliadaquae. As winter began to set in, the few surviving members of the Swords of Nier slogged home through the Cold Plains.

Now, as the long winter finally begins to release its icy grip on the land, the Swords find themselves in jeopardy. They still have firm control over the city of Nishanpur, and most of the surrounding portions of Canceri, but despite repeated attacks and protracted sieges, not all the necropolii of the Nerothians have been conquered. The Swords’ remaining forces are spread very thin, and as a result they have stopped pursuing active conquest and instead are mainly seeking to consolidate power and recruit new soldiers to bolster their depleted ranks. Meanwhile, the population of Canceri grows ever more restless under the iron rule of the Swords. Making matters worse, there are rumors of a plague beginning in the west of Canceri.

102844.name: As Gray and Cold as Stone
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102844.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

Elandré val’Assante, daughter of the Prelate of Coryan, invites the PCs to her father’s villa in Grand Coryan on a matter of some urgency and delicacy. When they arrive, they learn that Elandré is about to be engaged to Rurik val’Tensen, the son of
Milandir’s Duke of Moratavia. She has no desire to marry a Milandisian, and cannot fathom why her father, Acastus, refuses to tell her his reasons for the betrothal. She would like the PCs to find out why this marriage has been arranged, and perhaps to find a way to prevent it, depending on what they learn.

Depending on the PCs’ previous experiences, they may be presented as Elandré’s honored guests, or disguised as servants in her retinue. In either case, they will have opportunities to interact with many powerful figures from both Coryan and Milandir. However, they will not be able to learn much about
the marriage until the betrothal is formally announced.

102845.name: Grains of Sand
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102845.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

The Coryani province of Balantica grows the grain that sustains the Empire, and indeed much of the rest of the world. The val'Dellenov family controls this province and its bountiful farmlands, but they cannot manage it alone. For generations, five human families, collectively known as the grain factors, have been overseeing the harvesting, transportation and distribution of these massive amounts of grain. They have become well-established nobles as a result, and while they are constantly struggling against one another for increased prestige with the val'Dellenovs, they have always been loyal to their patrons and to the Empire…until now.

For reasons that are not immediately apparent, one of the grain factors, House Otrecto, has decided that it needs to hoard massive amounts of grain, and quickly. To this end, they have begun stealing grain from various locations throughout Coryan and storing it at a number of secret locations. One of these locations is an ancient Myrantian fortress hidden beneath the sands of the Forsaken Wastes. Otrecto agents in the fortress and the nearby towns have tricked a local hobgoblin warlord into doing their dirty work for them, leaving the agents to collect the grain undiscovered. Unfortunately for House Otrecto, the PCs have come along at exactly the wrong time.

102846.description:
(BGG User Summary:)

"The days of lightening strikes from the sky are over for you. There will be no more large scale offensives in which you take part. The Allies have the initiative and they are racing across France. Your duty is clear. As elite troops your are expected to fill the gaps and slow down the tide. The army's depending on you, Germany's depending on you, and your very lives are depending on how well you can perform the task assigned to you. Load up, and move out..."

Fallschirmjager is an expansion with alternate rules for Ambush! that allows for playing the original 8 missions from the German Fallschirmjager (Airborne) troops point of view. The rules contain information on how to substitute US units & counters for German ones, how to include German special weapons (Panzerfausts, Flamethrowers, etc.), and Victory Conditions for the modified missions.

The following 8 modified mission briefings are included:

Mission 1: Blutig St. Michaux
Mission 2: Retreat through Chasoul
Mission 3: Cold Morning in Belgium
Mission 4: Fallschirmjager
Mission 5: Fall Taschendieh
Mission 6: Assault on Fortress Belgium
Mission 7: To the Last Bullet
Mission 8: Battle of the Ardennes

Also included is a player aid sheet.  This includes charts on German equipment/weapons cost, squad member cost, a special German weapons chart showing the ranges and kill ratios for flamethrowers, panzerbucshe, panzerfaust, explosives, mortars, and shaped charges.  The player aid also includes a map of the conflict area and numbers corresponding to where each mission took place historically. 

This scenario/variant originally appeared in Battleplan Magazine (#2) May-June 1987. It was published by Diverse Talents, Inc. (also Fire & Movement and Space Gamer publisher).
102846.name: Fallschirmjager

102847.name: Where Illiir's Light Has Never Shone
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102847.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

The province of Toranesta, wrested from the control of the bloodthirsty Myrantians nearly ten centuries ago, has always been restless under the benevolent rule of the Coryani Empire. Despite the Empire's best efforts to keep the peace and bring prosperity to Toranesta, the people are wont to rise up in revolt at the slightest provocation…and such provocation seems likely to come again soon.

The PCs are summoned to this troubled land by Hemin val'Tensen, General of the Legion of Radiant Glory, whom they may have met in LA-HP2-01: As Gray and Cold as Stone. Unfortunately, before they can find out what he wants of them, the General is attacked and incapacitated by a shapeshifting infernal. At the same time, the people of Abessios rise once more in open revolt.

102848.name: Wake
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102848.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

Diotimus Verus was a traveling scholar for the Emerald Society. Two years ago, he discovered an ancient portal in the caverns beyond the dwarven enclave of Encali. Thinking it was a Portal of Anshar, he activated it. However, he found himself transported far from home, and was soon captured by a strange race of cat-like beings, who interrogated him in great detail about his homeland, the Coryani Empire.

After being interrogated constantly for nearly two years, Diotimus learned that his captors had something planned which would spell trouble for the Empire, and that the life of the Patriarch of the Mother Church was in danger. Shortly thereafter, Diotimus managed to escape, and returned to Encali through the same portal he had left through originally.

Diotimus immediately went to a local friend of the Emerald Society, the dwarven jeweler Qomas. Explaining the problem, he borrowed money, clothes and a few small items from Qomas, and then set off for the city of Enpebyn, where the Patriarch was currently located.

102849.name: To Shake the Pillars of Heaven: Part 1
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102849.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

Welcome to the finale of Season Two: To Shake the Pillars of Heaven. In actuality, this is not so much a finale’ as a campaign cliffhanger. By the end of this two part adventure, a major NPC will be dead, the Empire will be thrown into chaos, PC loyalty will be stretched to the limit and of course, the big surprise at the end.

There are two major villain factions in this adventure, though only one appears in Part I – the Brotherhood of Man and their apparent leader, the Albino.

102850.name: To Shake the Pillars of Heaven: Part 2
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102850.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

The characters have accomplished their immediate goal of tracking down the group responsible for a series of murders in Coryan, and have also found the proof necessary to free their patron, Senator Tensen-Balin, from his wrongful imprisonment. However, they are also aware that Elandré val'Assanté is likely to be the cult's next victim.

While attempting to save Elandré, the PCs are drawn ever more tightly into a mighty web of intrigue among the most powerful people on Onara. Before the day is done, they will be responsible for recovering one of the most sacred artifacts of the Mother Church, and will witness events which will throw the Empire into turmoil and literally reshape the world of Onara.

102852.name: The Children of Leviathan
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102852.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

This scenario is set along the high southern coast of the Republic of Altheria, and deals with the brazen theft of the annual shipment of blastpowder destined for Naeraanth in the Kingdom of Milandir. The culprits are a mysterious conclave of degenerate pirates who worship a primal godlet called simply Leviathan, a heretical version of Yarris as Dark Master of the Depths.

For uncounted years, ships traversing the vaunted rocky coast of the Altherian headland have been plagued by many hazards. Unpredictable currents beset passing vessels, along with uncharted jungle islets, craggy reefs, and chaotic torrential weather that follows no set pattern. Rarely there are great aquatic beasts and piracy, but the small fleet of the Altherian Patrol along with Altherian gunships that safeguard passage through the Sea of Yarris fend off regular attacks.

However, one stretch of the Altherian coast in particular has always remained obscure and not yet fully explored - the Milguldihar Straits, giving the Patrol its fair share of troubles and surprises. Lying along Altheria’s southern border, this cliff-lined coast drops steadily in altitude as it ventures west, culminating in the Bay of Spines. The Straits are also entrenched behind the Ophidian Isles - a wall of interlocked archipelagoes covered in gnarled jungle forest and steaming mangrove marshes. To make matters worse, cold fronts rolling off the high Altherian plateau collide with the humid Bay of Spines, forming vast, long-lived fog banks that stretch for leagues. It is here that the most dreaded of sea reavers dwell.

102853.name: The Senator's Seal
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102853.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

Senator Okpara val’Inares of Toranesta was indulging himself in the marketplace, examining the wares of the city’s finer cloth makers. At the same time, Dardanus, a wealthy landholder from outside the city had brought his stock into market, and was attempting to purchase silk cloth for his wife. The two met while examining fabrics and Dardanus accidentally bumped into the Senator, who, despite the farmers’ polite apology, roughly shoved the farmer and berated him for his clumsiness. Dardanus shrugged it off and continued to search for the elusive fabric while the Senator went elsewhere. This otherwise unremarkable chance meeting sets in motion the events of this adventure.

Shortly thereafter, the fabric merchant, Aljandros, found a velvet pouch. Looking within he saw that it contained a small golden rod. Pleased with his good fortune, he left his booth to the care of his son to try and sell it before the owner returned. In his eagerness and haste to make good on his fortuitous discovery, he neglected to remove the item from the pouch. If he had, he would have discovered that it was an imperial seal, the seal of Senator Okpara val’Inares to be precise.

He took the object to a pawnbroker known to be somewhat… flexible… in her buying habits. After examining it, the pawnbroker refused to purchase it. Instead she informed her contacts in the Cafelan Cartel of its importance. Shortly thereafter the word was on the street and the race was on.

102854.name: Roundball: 2-on-2 Challenge
102854.description:
User Summary

In this exciting basketball game you get to play two-on-two on half a court. You get to choose your own team from among 24 fictional basketball players, each with their own individual stats, and compete against up to three other teams in a round-robin format. Players are rated on an array of skills such as two and three point shots, personal fouls, stealing, blocking, rebounds, assists and free throws. There is also an option of a one-on-one game.

102855.name: Double Draughts
102855.description:
This is a game in the checkers/draughts family played on an 8x8 board, using 24 pieces aside.

This game originated from asking two simple question regarding Anglo-America checkers: First, why is only half the spaces used? Second, what would happen if you used all 64 spaces of a checkerboard?

End result is a game in the checkers/draughts family which tries to remain true to regular checkers, also accounts for the full use of the board. Checkers move as they do normally, but they also jump both diagonally and orthogonally. In addition, the King piece gains mobility to be like a King in chess.

102856.name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team
102856.description:
We are happy to announce our fast-paced arcade shooter, Warhammer® 40,000®: Kill Team for Xbox LIVE® online entertainment network and Playstation® Network as well as a unique weapon unlock for Warhammer® 40,000®: Space Marine® that can be accessed by playing the game.

In this third person arcade style shooter, players take on the role of an elite Space Marine team sent to assault a giant Ork Kroozer en-route to an Imperial Forge World. Do you have what it takes to take out the Warboss and prevent the Waaaagh?

Kill Team allows players to choose from four unique classes, including ranged specialists the Sternguard Veteran and Techmarine, and more melee focused classes like the Vanguard Veteran and Librarian. With two-player same screen Co-operative play, multiple weapon upgrades and six iconic Space Marine chapters to select from, Kill Team is a must-play for fans of Warhammer® 40,000®

Source: The Game Website.

102857.name: Balance of Power: The 1990 Edition
102857.description:
Balance of Power: The 1990 Edition was a special edition release of Balance of Power sometimes referred to as Balance of Power II). It was released simultaneously on five platforms in 1989 after the original achieved many sales.

The 1990 edition adds more countries, advisors to help out the player, a new "multi-polar" level that allows countries to generate events of their own (such as declaring war on other countries), and a few miscellaneous features. However, with the ending of the Cold War, interest declined, and there have been no further follow-ups or clones.

Source: Wikipedia, "Balance of Power (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

From the back of the box:

It has been several years since the release of the original Balance of Power. In that time the political voices in the world have changed dramatically.
Now, in response to popular demand, master game designer Chris Crawford gives us Balance of Power: The 1990 Edition - a new and enhanced game of global politics and power struggles. Featuring a new multipolar level, this game allows 80 countries to ship weapons and troops, and fight wars; your challenge as a superpower is to monitor their policies and use your influence - at times to the point of diplomatic crisis - to protect your interests.

NEW FEATURES


Covers eight years, from 1989 to 1997
Simulates real world political struggles in the nuclear age by allowing interaction among 80 countries (formerly 62)
Allows 4 levels of play, from Beginner to the complex Multipolar level.
Utilizes a vast and updated database and faster processing capabilities
Icludes a four person on-screen "crisis advisory" group forcounsel in crises
Enhanced with non-nuclear war feature for smaller countries
Includes both 1- and 2-player games

102858.name: Raving Rabbids Party Collection
102858.description:
User Summary

Raving Rabbids Party Collection offers 3 hit games in 1: Rayman Raving Rabbids, Rayman Raving Rabbids 2, and Rayman Raving Rabbids TV Party.

102859.name: FURT
102859.description:
From the makers of Quelf comes another party game designed to make you do more wacky things in sixty minutes than you'd normally do in day – heck, maybe an entire week. In FURT, you race against other players to try to be the first one to jump into a volcano. Why? Glory, fame, hot feet – whatever the reason, you're doing it.

You move ahead in the game by completing actions in six categories, possibly making up outrageous lies about yourself, freshening up with a quick shower in your host's bathroom, or acting out the words "butter patty". The categories are:

• The Volcano Has Spoken – Roll a black and you'll be subject to the whims of the volatile FURT volcano, which is sometimes angry, sort of bossy and always a bit weird.

• Straight-Faced – Can you keep a straight face while your friends and family members assault you with funny words? You're about to find out (psst: fluffer nougat, pussy willow, burp nut) whenever you roll a red.

• Guess What? – The volcano is chock full of funny words and you may find yourself acting out the phrase "butter patty" or drawing an invisible jet to get your friends to guess your word when you roll a green.

• Truth or Fiction? – Roll a purple and you reveal something about yourself. Is it truth or fiction? Only you know. The more people you fool, the more you move ahead!

• You Are... – Not yourself when you roll a yellow. Maybe you are having an identity crisis, who knows? Just be who the card says for thirty seconds and you can move ahead.

• What The?! – When you roll a blue, you'll get a TOP SECRET card that you must perform before your next turn. It could be annoying, outlandish, confusing, obnoxious or just plain freakish. You have been warned.

102860.name: Crimsonworld
102860.description:
One hero. Tons of monsters. And weapons. A LOT OF WEAPONS.

Are you ready for pure, non-stop action without any other stupid stuff?
This is CRIMSONWORLD HD. Doom-style bloody mess, with a top-down view.

✭ FEATURES ✭

✔ Perks system
✔ 25 unique locations
✔ 12 types of futuristic weapon
✔ Tons of deadly monsters
✔ Quest, Rush and Survival modes
✔ Stunning pre-rendered graphics
✔ AI Mode for the begginers
✔ Demo Mode to impress your friends

For Demo Mode, just wait a few seconds on the main menu screen.

Source: The Game Website.

102861.name: Tidewater Traveller Times (Volume 1, Issue 5 - Oct 1987)
102861.description:
Dulinor Returns to Dlan

From the Credits:

The Tidewater Traveller TIMES is the official newsletter of the Tidewater Traveller Club.

Editor: Mark "Mad Geo" Gelinas

102862.name: Tidewater Traveller Times (Volume 1, Issue 6 - Nov 1987)
102862.description:
Special SCI-CON Issue

From the Credits:

The Tidewater Traveller TIMES is published monthly and is the official newsletter of the Tidewater Traveller Club.

Editor: Mark "Mad Geo" Gelinas

102863.name: It is Warm Work- Age of Sail Naval Rules
102863.description:
It is Warm Work is a set of easy to play rules for fighting fleet battles in the Age of Sail using miniatures or cardboard counters. The rules recreate the flavor of the period with a minimal amount of complexity. The rules were written with a focus on the period 1740-1815, but can easily be used to re-fight Age of Sail Battles from before and after those dates.

The intent of the rules was to provide for the ability for a single player to use a large number of ships and for the game to be concluded with a clear winner in a single 3 to 4 hour gaming session.

The end product is a balance between the reality and game. It is Warm Work strikes a fair balance between period flavor and ease of play. The system is pretty basic when compared to most rules for the period, but the rules give good solid results that reflect the period.

Available as a PDF (rules and markers). Scenarios, ship counter images and discussion available at the Yahoo Group ItisWarmWork.

102864.name: A Wanderer's Romance (2011)
102864.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world began as nothing but ocean. The Origins raised up a million colourful islands, anything larger than a few dozen miles being swallowed by the envious deep. Some of these immaterial beings chose to take a physical form and live in the varied lands they had created, eventually settling into the forms of men and beasts. Our ancestors.

The Origins that did not take physical form paid a great cost. They were left unable to affect their world directly, relying upon influencing men with words and knowledge. Their teachings led to our understanding of elemental balance, the formation of the thousand Legendary Styles and the universal code of combat that define our world today.

You are a great man or woman. An errant trained in both the noble art of combat and in contests of body and mind. Drifting from one island to another, you have your own philosophy on life and the power to enforce it.

A Wanderer's Romance is a game of martial art duels and tea-making contests set in a world of unnatural islands on an endless sea. It draws on its Wuxia influences but focuses on a character driven game with scope for incredible environments and a true sense of exploration.

Features of the game include:

A fast, simple and easy to learn system for task resolution that spreads consistently across duels, contests, activities and group tests.
Dozens of combat styles for characters to learn as well as countless other types of contest they can specialise in.
A setting outline designed for maximum creative freedom. Every group's world will be different but will share in similar themes.
Multiple ways to support your allies from teaching them lessons in defeat and envigorating them through activities to training them in combat styles and preparing tea and food that will balance their elemental forces.

102865.name: Tidewater Traveller Times (Volume 1, Issue 7 - Dec 1987)
102865.description:
Peninsula Chapter Formed

From the Credits:

The Tidewater Traveller TIMES is the official newsletter of the Tidewater Traveller Club.

Editor: Mark "Mad Geo" Gelinas

102866.name: All that Glitters
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102866.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

A hundred and fifty years ago, the pirate known as Captain Khardin plundered his last ships - a trading convoy carrying goods from Khitan. The convoy also carried the august personage of Garniss the Sage, a noted diviner and researcher of many new and unique spells.

After looting the ships, Khardin hid the treasure and left a stone carving in the care of his mistress detailing where it could be found. Then he sailed off for one last raid before the rainy season began - and never returned.

His mistress was killed by a rival pirate seeking Khardin’s plunder, and he was unable to decipher the stone. So it passed from hand to hand until it finally came to the Temple of Althares some thirty years later, where it was duly cataloged and its legend noted, and that was the end of it - except for the occasional band of adventurers to come along and try their hand at the puzzle.

About twenty years ago, one such band came and made a rubbing of the stone, intending to take it to a noted Loremaster in Althares itself. They succeeded, and received a cryptic verse from the Loremaster’s legend lore, but before they could return to seek the treasure, half the party was wiped out saving a small village from a Ss’ressen incursion.

The fragments of their notes, however, survived until the present day, where they are found by the PCs.

102867.name: Cast Upon Tides of Weal and Woe
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102867.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

While on a sea voyage from Censure to Freeport in the Pirate Isles, the PCs rescue a young boy from a drowning wreck. Their fates become intertwined with the succession of the Sea Lord of Freeport. The ancient feud between the House of Drac and the House of Francisco lies at the heart of the tale, and those who covet what is not theirs hamper all attempts to settle an account long past due.

102868.name: The Serpentine Path
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102868.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

A council of seven individuals called The Council of Wisdom governs the Republic of Altheria. However, this council is deeply divided. Four of the members want to maintain the status quo, but the other three members advocate sweeping changes. The radical faction wants to withhold blast powder shipments from all of Onara and use the powder to build huge bombs to destroy the Ssethregoran menace forever. To protect Altheria from the inevitable backlash of a blast powder embargo, they also want to petition Althares for his third gift. This radical group only needs one thing to gain the popular support necessary to take such drastic steps, a major Ssethregoran victory over the Shining Patrol. The radicals have decided to make this event happen, and they have chosen a city to sacrifice to their grand plan. The chosen city is named Semar.

102869.name: Unpaid Debts
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
102869.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

This scenario deals with the disappearance of an ancient blade of power forged by the legendary swordsmith, Dar val’Assante as a gift to the val’Tensen family. It was lost so many millennia ago to the fortunes of war and only recently uncovered.

Now, servants of an alien malfeasance have stolen this blade. This was done in part to prevent unity among the families of the Val, but also to attract the attention of the heroes, some of whom it has already gained an interest in. Indeed, the characters themselves are the true objects of the otherworldly foe; the sword is but a welcome bonus.

But there is an uncontrolled element that not even this far-seeing foe could have anticipated. With the loss of Beltine’s Serenity, the shades of the lost are unquiet and they still seek to fulfill in death, what duties eluded them in life.

102870.description:
Flummox is a tug of war fought with cards and brains. Each player has an exposed hand of cards they use to move and shift the Flummox token around the table. Sometimes players want to get the Flummox to land in their own hand, and sometimes it's best to send the Flummox to another player. Special cards can Stop, Bounce, Slide, and Bump the Flummox as it travels around the ring...sometimes with surprising results.

Flummox is a card game for 2 to 5 players and is suitable for families, parties, and gamers alike. The box includes 108 cards, a rule book, and an oh-so-cute Flummox figurine.
102870.name: Flummox
boardgamepodcastepisode: The One About Family Ties

102871.name: Stacktics
boardgameversion: Game Crafter 3-6 players primary & secondary colors edition
The Game Crafter primary colors + black edition
The Game Crafter secondary colors + white edition
102871.description: Stacktics is a game where the aim is for players to create 4 stacks of 2 tokens that match their unique reference stack. This is done by building and manipulating stacks of tokens in the centre of the table. In turn players can draw a token from the draw bag to add to the central stacks, or perform a single manipulation, or place their blocking piece to protect a stack.

102872.name: Déjà Vu II: Lost in Las Vegas
videogameversion: North American DOS 5.25" Floppy Disk edition
North American DOS Dual Media edition
102872.description:
From the back of the box:

Welcome to the world of Deja Vu - and to Las Vegas, the city that never sleeps - the city of excitement! Actually, you've already had plenty of excitement in the last 48 hours. You've been abducted by two thugs from Chicago, grilled by the notorious Las Vegas mobster Tony Malone, knocked senseless and tossed into a bathtub in a cheap Vegas hotel. It couldn't possibly get any worse than this, could it?

Deja Vu II: Lost in Las Vegas. You will meet the nicest people you want to play with. But they don't play nice. And if you don't come up with 100,000 big ones in the next 7 days, it may be the last game you'll ever play!

Deja Vu II: Lost in Las Vegas is the spellbinding sequel to the interactive graphic adventure game Deja Vu. This exciting, state-of-the-art thriller, in the tradition of the award winning original, draws you right into the action. There are no cumbersome commands to type, no guessing what to do. You are totally free to explore and manipulate the objects in every detailed screen, choosing your own path through the mystery. You select from a multitude of clues that may help you save your neck - or lead to an early demise.

Deja Vu is like no other game you've ever experienced.

102873.name: Cold Fear
102873.description:
In Cold Fear the player takes on the role of Tom Hansen, a former soldier now in the employ of the United States Coast Guard who has been sent in to investigate a mysterious Russian whaler Eastern Spirit in the middle of the Bering strait. The beginning cut-scenes show a SEAL team under the orders of a CIA agent, identifying the ship and trying to discover its cargo. Unfortunately, the SEAL squad is slaughtered mercilessly by an unknown threat. CIA agent Bennett then orders any government vessel in the vicinity of the Russian boat to investigate, and it is Hansen's ship which responds. As Hansen, the player finds out that the boat is occupied by hostile Russian soldiers and by strange creatures, known as "exocells", that use humans and other life forms as hosts to feed on and to use as protection from the environment. These parasites are a threat to Hansen from inside and outside their host bodies. His investigation leads to the mystery of the ship and its lethal cargo as well as the unethical experiments which were being carried out aboard the ship.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cold Fear," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102874.name: Reign of Fire
102874.description:
Reign of Fire is an action-adventure video game released in 2002 by Kuju Entertainment. The game is based on the movie of the same name, in which dragons have annihilated the majority of the human race, and the survivors attempt to fight back using scavenged military hardware.

Source: Wikipedia, "Reign of Fire (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102875.description:
Game description from the publisher:

After a long and difficult hunt, the heroes of Middle-earth have captured Gollum and now escort their prisoner back to King Thranduil's palace in Mirkwood. There, Gandalf the Grey hopes to interrogate the wretched creature for the information he suspects may keep the One Ring out of the Dark Lord's clutches. But the journey back won't be easy!

The sixth and conclusive Adventure Pack in the "Shadows of Mirkwood" cycle, Return to Mirkwood puts your heroes in the difficult position of escorting Gollum through some of the darkest and most dangerous locations of Mirkwood forest. New predators stalk through the forest, drawn by Gollum's tantrums.

Return to Mirkwood expands the card pool for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game with 60 new cards, including a challenging new Quest, a new hero, and three copies each of new attachments, allies, and events.
102875.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Return to Mirkwood
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Game Night Kit 2013 Season Three
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Return to Mirkwood
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

102876.name: Mercenaries and Rebels
102876.description:
Players throw dice to move from prison in Bab Alazizia to Tripoli. The game starts at a square in Benghazi marked February 17th (2011), Libya's first "day of rage". It ends at a square in Tripoli marked Freedom.

From The Economist: http://www.economist.com/blogs/newsbook/2011/07/libya

102877.name: Hollowpoint
rpghonor: 2012 ENnie for Product of the Year - Nominee
2012 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
102877.description:
From the back cover:

No one in this game is innocent.

You're an Agent. No one ever messes with you, because you are that far above the common herd of men that sleepwalk through their lives. You get things done, and that usually means blood. Or pain. Or, when you are feeling generous, death.

Inspired by every ultraviolent action movie you've ever seen, Hollowpoint is about being that good at something that bad. Make no mistake: you will be a very, very bad person.

From the VSCA, who brought you Diaspora, winner of the 2010 ENnie for Best Rules in an RPG, comes a new pick-up game where death is expected. To play you'll need this book, pencils and paper, a whole mess of six-sided dice, and maybe a first aid kit.

102878.name: Mushroom Men: The Spore Wars
102878.description:
The story begins when a comet crashes to the Earth, raining down a strange green dust in its wake. The space dust is harmless to humans and goes unnoticed, but they failed to notice that flora, fauna and fungi including mushrooms, cacti, and kudzu gained sentience. Also, this strange green dust mutated some of the animals too (such as rabbits, moles, spiders, opossums, etc.). In order to survive, the newly conscious mushroom people soon formed into tribes, and war inevitably followed. The story of The Spore Wars on Wii also chronicles the life of the main character Pax, a lone bolete mushroom who is trying to find his place in mushroom society.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mushroom Men," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
102881.description:
Trench is an abstract strategy game for two players based on the trench wars of World War I. Unlike most games, in Trench the 8x8 grid board is diamond-shaped; each player sets up his army on opposing sides of the "trench", which divides the board into two.
